record.field: 1. A taxpayer is a taxpayer of a private person or entity whose business circulation of the tax year before the tax year lasts no more than...
2. Income tax imposed on UMKM taxpayers is regulated in the regulations...
3. The amount of Final Income Tax Article 4 paragraph 2 for MSME Taxpayers in 2017 amounted to ..... from gross circulation every month.

4. On May 5, 2018, the Treasurer of BPKAD Kab. Cianjur purchased 2 units of computers with a DPP value of Rp. 10,000,000, - (Associate with NPWP and attaching a Certificate of Income Tax Free Article 22 at the time of collection) How much tax does the Treasurer deposit?
D. Final Income Tax Article 4(2) of 0.5%

5. On September 10, 2018, the Treasurer of BPKAD Kab. Cianjur repaired a computer with a DPP value for the services of Rp. 2,000,000, - (Business entity associate with NPWP and attached a Certificate of Income Tax Free Article 23 at billing) How much tax has the Treasurer deposited?
B. Cut Income Tax Article 4(2) by 0.5%
D. Cut Income Tax Article 4(2) by 1%

6. On September 10, 2018, BPKAD Treasurer Kab. Cianjur printed a government accounting training module with a DPP value for the services of Rp. 1,000,000,- (Private Person Partners with NPWP and do not attach a PPh-Free Certificate when collecting) How much tax does the Treasurer deposit?
C. Final Income Tax Article 4(2) of 10%
D. Final Income Tax Article 4(2) of 0.5%
7. on September 10, 2018, BPKAD Treasurer Kab. Cianjur rented a room to Bank BJB for bimtek activities with a DPP value on the rent of Rp. 10,000,000, - How much tax does the Treasurer pay?
A. Final Income Tax Article 4(2) amounting to Rp. 500,000
B. Final Income Tax Article 4(2) amounting to Rp. 1.000,000
C. Final Income Tax Article 4(2) amounting to Rp. 100,000
D. Final Income Tax Article 4(2) amounting to Rp. 200,000
8. The currency code of the tax account and the deposit type code for the withholding of final income tax article 4 paragraph 2 to the UMKM Taxpayer are.
9. Final Income Tax Article 4 paragraph 2 on the deduction of income tax of MSME taxpayers must be deposited by the treasurer no later than...
A. the 7th of the next tax period
B. the 10th of the next tax period
C. the 15th of the next tax period
D. the 20th of the next tax period
10. How to fill out the SSP for the collection of PPh Article 22 collected by the Regional Government Treasurer from NPWP partners is...
A. SSP filled with associate identity, map-KJS code 411122-920
B. SSP filled with treasurer identity, MAP-KJS code 411122-920
C. SSP filled with partner identity, map-KJS code 411211-920
D. SSP filled with the identity of the treasurer, map-KJS code 411211-920
11. If two brothers gives inherited building on rental basis exemption available from services tax is charged ____
12. Service tax rules makes it…......... for an assessee to preserve records for at least Five years
13. As per valuation rules of service tax, value of taxable service shall be determined by______
15. Any sum received under life insurance policy on maturity, including the sum allocated by way of bonus on such policy shall be _____ from tax
16. Income by way of interest, premium, etc from certain ______ as specified / notified in the official gazette are exmpted from tax
17. What is the Full Form of ITR?
18. The basic rate of income tax on non-savings income for tax year 2017-18 is :
19. Which of the following types of income is not generally exempt from income tax?
B. A benefit in kind provided to an employee by an employer
D. Income from Individual Savings Accounts
20. If a married couple (or civil partners) receive joint income, the amount of that income will always be divided equally between them for tax purposes. True or False?

21. A taxpayer has taxable income for 2017-18 (after deducting the personal allowance) of £74,115. The taxpayer is not Scottish and none of the income is derived from savings or dividends. The income tax liability for the year is :

22. A Scottish taxpayer has total income for 2017-18 of £185,300. None of the income is derived from savings or dividends and the personal allowance for the year is zero. The income tax liability for the year is :
23. In tax year 2017-18, building society interest received by an individual is received without deduction of tax at source. True or False?
24. A person may refuse to pay on the ground that he will not receive a benefit from the tax
25. Which factor has no role in the shifting of a tax?
C. Elasticity of demand and supply
26. Impact of a tax refers to _____
A. In the long period shifting of a tax is easy
B. In the short period, shifting of a tax is easy
C. When supply is elastic, shifting is easy
28. Pick out the factor which is not a feature of indirect taxes
D. Powerful tool of economic policy
29. The objective of taxation by the Government are _____
A. To remove disparities in the distribution of income
C. Raising revenue for the state
30. What is the cost of an item priced regularly for $60.00 that now has a 20% discount?
